{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3709471,"name":"Vincent Banks","username":"v0ncent","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/v0ncent/{size}/258352_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-10T22:31:12.729Z","cooked":"

We are using multiple orange pi’s running photonvision and are confused on how you can access the different dashboards of each orange pi’s pv instance.

Is there multiple ports photonvision will run on if the 5800 port is already running an instance ?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-08-10T22:31:12.729Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":69.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505169,"topic_slug":"accessing-different-instances-of-photon-vision-on-network","display_username":"Vincent Banks","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56270,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/accessing-different-instances-of-photon-vision-on-network/505169/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3709478,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-10T22:38:56.856Z","cooked":"

Follow the instructions in the PhotonVision documentation to configure both a unique hostname and static IP address (in your case, 10.78.49.11, 10.78.49.12, etc) for each Orange Pi. A port is for distinguishing multiple services on the same computer, so they don’t need different ports, whereas IP addresses distinguish between different networks and computers. Then, you can access each one at http://<hostname or IP address>:5800.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-08-10T22:40:34.064Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":104.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505169,"topic_slug":"accessing-different-instances-of-photon-vision-on-network","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/quick-start/networking.html#network-hostname","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Networking - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":1},{"url":"https://docs.photonvision.org/en/latest/docs/quick-start/networking.html#robot-networking","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Networking - PhotonVision Docs","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/accessing-different-instances-of-photon-vision-on-network/505169/2","custom_user_title":"246 Software Lead","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3709523,"name":"Sam","username":"Sam948","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sam948/{size}/261363_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-11T00:30:33.123Z","cooked":"

The one caveat I will add is that you should generally use IP address instead of host name, since the host name you set isn’t always guaranteed due to host name resolution on the radio.

I’ll also add that if you are using port forwarding on the roboRIO, you’ll need to assign each orange pi 5800 port to be forwarded to an individual roboRIO port. Easiest way is probably:

orangepi1:5800 → roborio:5800,
orangepi2:5800 → roborio:5801,
orangepi3:5800 → roborio:5802,
etc
